New Records: Lu Dort scored 20 points, Chet Holmgren added 19, and Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 18 points for the Thunder, setting up their victory over the Spurs. The Thunder made a team record 17 out of 41 three-pointers in the game.
Key Match Events: The Thunder expanded their lead to 93-81 after a key stretch where Ajay Mitchell scored five points, turning the game in their favor despite Shai Gilgeous-Alexander being on the bench.
Pre-Game Insights: The Thunder demonstrated their ability to handle challenging matchups even when key players like Shai Gilgeous-Alexander were struggling with their shooting performance.
Post-Match Reflections: The Spurs struggled with their field goal percentage, shooting 41.2%, and struggled to generate enough offense for their young star Victor Wembanyama, who was held to six points on 1-for-5 shooting.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Thunder's victory extended their unbeaten streak to 4-0 in the Western Conference, showing their dominance early in the season. The Spurs' 93 points marked their lowest total of the season.
